required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Postoperative Effects of Chewing Gum, Ibuprofen and Acetaminophen on Pain After Initial Archwire Placement
clinical_study.official_title: Postoperative Effects of Chewing Gum, Ibuprofen and Acetaminophen on Pain After Initial Archwire Placement: a Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the efficacy of ibuprofen, acetaminophen, chewing gum in reducing orthodontic pain. This study include 81 patients to be classified into 4 groups of 19 each: ibuprofen (400 mg), acetaminophen (500 mg), chewing gum and control. The patients in each group will receive 1 method immediately after placement of the initial archwire and every 6 hours for a week if they experiences pain. Pain perception will be recorded by the patients while jaw rest position and fitting back teeth at 2 hours, 24 hours, 2 days, 3 days, 7 days and 21 days after archwire placement, using a visual analog scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Orthodontic pain measurement by marking 100 millimeters visual analogue scales.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours, 24 hours, 2 days, 3 days, 7 days and 21 days after archwire placement.
primary_outcome.description: to compare the efficacy of ibuprofen, acetaminophen and chewing gum in changing orthodontic pain by marking in between two points in a 100 millimeters visual analogue scale that starts from the left (no pain) and end to the right (exacerbated pain) at different time points.

secondary_outcome.measure: Chewing gum as a non pharmacologic alternative for orthodontic pain control by marking 100 millimeters visual analogue scales.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours, 24 hours, 2 days, 3 days, 7 days and 21 days after archwire placement.
secondary_outcome.description: to verify if chewing gum can be a non-pharmacologic method for orthodontic pain control by marking in between two points in a 100 millimeters visual analogue scale that starts from the left (no pain) and ends to the right (exacerbated pain) at different time points.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain at rest X fitting back teeth by marking 100 millimeters visual analogue scales.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours, 24 hours, 2 days, 3 days, 7 days and 21 days after archwire placement.
secondary_outcome.description: to verify wich group has less pain and if in rest or in fitting back teeth by marking in between two points in a 100 millimeters visual analogue scale that starts from the left (no pain) and end to the right (exacerbated pain) at different time points.

arm_group.description: ibuprofen (400 mg) immediately after insertion of the initial archwire and 6/6 hs for a week if there is any orthodontic pain.
acetaminophen (500 mg) immediately after insertion of the initial archwire and 6/6 hs for a week if there is any orthodontic pain.
chewing gum (01 tablet) immediately after insertion of the initial archwire and 6/6 hs of chewing gum for a week if there is any orthodontic pain.

intervention.description: prescription of one tablet of chewing gum

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- moderate teeth crowding
- no need for tooth extraction to orthodontic reasons
Exclusion Criteria:
- presence of autoimmune diseases
- history of orthodontic treatment with fixed appliances
